intro: Tetragonia herbacea, commonly known as New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves that are often used as a leafy vegetable. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Tetragonia herbacea is valued for its nutritional content and ability to grow in harsh environmental conditions.
